chat_history.user: save this to the database: My Raspberry Pi setup is complete
chat_history.sani:
Sure, here's an example Python code that saves your message to a database using SQLite:
```python
import sqlite3
conn = sqlite3.connect('mydatabase.db')
c = conn.cursor()
c.execute("INSERT INTO messages (message) VALUES ('My Raspberry Pi setup is complete')")
conn.commit()
conn.close()
```
This code creates a new SQLite database file called "mydatabase.db" and inserts your message into the "messages" table. You can replace "mydatabase.db" with the name of your own database file, and you can modify the `INSERT INTO` statement to insert your message into a different table if needed.
